doc.name: defaultNetworkInterface
doc.summary: Determines which network interface should be used for socketed and HTTP connections.

description.overview: Use the defaultNetworkInterface property on all desktop and server platforms to specify which network interface should be used for socketed and HTTP connections. This is useful if you have SSL certificates bound to a particular IP address.

parameter.name: networkInterface
parameter.description: An IPv4 address as a string. For example: "192.168.1.10"

description.comments:
If the defaultNetworkInterface is empty, the standard interface is used.
If the defaultNetworkInterface is not valid interface, an error is present in the result of the connection attempt.
SSL certificates are bound to a particular IP address. If your device has multiple network interfaces, to utilize your SSL certificate set the defaultNetworkInterface to the address specified in the certificate.
